## E3 2018 Highlights: All the E3 games, trailers and news you need to know
about

**E3 2018 has almost wrapped up, and this year’s show has seen an assortment
of exciting announcements, reveals and surprises across all platforms. There’s
a lot get through, so we’ve compiled everything you need to know about 2018
including all the must-see trailers, briefings and more.**

The conference itself has opened its doors after we saw a number of press
conferences from the key players in the industry. EA and Microsoft got the
ball rolling with [EA Play 2018](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-to-
watch-ea-e3-press-conference-3480091) and [Microsoft’s own
keynote](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-to-watch-xbox-e3-2018-press-
conference-3475364), and [Bethesda](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-
to-watch-bethesda-e3-press-conference-3480032), [Square
Enix](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-to-watch-square-
enix-e3-2018-conference-3478151),
[Ubisoft](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-to-watch-ubisoft-e3-press-
conference-3480123), [Sony](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-to-watch-
sony-ps4-e3-2018-press-conference-3471683) and
[Nintendo](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-to-watch-nintendo-
direct-e3-2018-3477902) followed with presentations of their own. Read on for
full details of everything that has been announced thus far, and keep checking
back on this page as we update it with our hands-on impressions of the
playable games.

**Related:[When is Amazon Prime
Day?](https://www.trustedreviews.com/deals/amazon-prime-day-2018-3482743)**

Let’s kick-off by taking a closer look at what the biggest E3 players –
including Nintendo, Sony, Microsoft, EA, Bethesda and more – have been up at
the world’s biggest games show.

## Nintendo at E3 2018

Now that Nintendo has proven the worth of its latest console, the [Nintendo
Switch](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/nintendo-switch), it’s time to
bulk out its library with fantastic games.

As a result, E3 2018 gave us our best look yet at [Super Smash Bros
Ultimate](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/smash-bros-nintendo-switch-
release-date-gameplay-2949964), with a host of new characters announced (Star
Fox’s Wolf and Metroid’s Ridley are a playable characters!) and a December
2018 release date given.

We also got the news that Epic Games’ [Fortnite Battle
Royale](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/fortnite-battle-royale) will be
available on Switch tonight, so you’ve one more platform to play the global
blockbuster. The new version will also offer cross-play with the Xbox One, PC,
mobile, although PS4 cross-play is not supported.

Finally, we also got our first look at Fire Emblem: Three Houses, an upcoming
strategy RPG. That was it in terms of major announcements, although be sure to
check out our [Nintendo E3 guide](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-to-
watch-nintendo-direct-e3-2018-3477902) for a full rundown.

Overall, it was a somewhat predictable conference. That’s no bad thing, but it
would have been nice to see a surprise or two such as an update on [Metroid
Prime 4](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/metroid-prime-4-release-date-
gameplay-news-trailer-characters-story-preorder-2993245). Nintendo knows what
it’s doing, which occasionally means it gets a little bit predictable.

## Microsoft at E3 2018

It has the hardware, now it needs the games, and Microsoft delivered with
amazing style at E3 2018. The console manufacturer’s conference was almost
entirely a non-stop announcement bonanza, as game after game received new
details, demonstrations and trailers.

The highlight of the show was undoubtedly [Cyberpunk
2077](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/cyberpunk-2077-release-date-trailer-
gameplay-story-2948412), which closed out the conference with its first in-
game trailer, but Microsoft also announced all new games ranging from [Forza
Horizon 4](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/forza-horizon-4-release-date-
news-trailer-gameplay-wishlist-cars-3382198) to [Halo
Infinite](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/halo-infinite-release-
date-3484012) and [Gears of War 5](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/gears-
of-war-5-news-release-date-2949338).

Third party publishers also saw their games announced at the conference with
[Just Cause 4](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/just-cause-4-release-
date-3478275) and [Devil May Cry 5](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/devil-
may-cry-5-dmc-release-date-3334071) receiving debut trailers.

## Sony at E3 2018

Although Sony made a handful of announcements in the run up to E3, such as
announcing that popular VR game Beatsaber will be coming to PlayStation VR and
finally giving zombie game Gone Home a release date, we got the main bulk of
information from [Sony’s conference](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/sony-
playstation-e3-2018-press-conference-how-to-watch-playstation-3471683).

Here, the focus was on giving extended looks at a small number of big games.
We saw an extended piece of gameplay from  [The Last of Us Part
2](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/last-of-us-2-release-date-gameplay-
trailer-pre-order-news-wishlist-2944236), [Spider-
Man](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/spiderman-ps4-2993195) and [Ghosts of
Tsushima](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/ghost-of-tsushima-release-date-
trailers-story-3319443), and [Death
Stranding](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/death-stranding-release-
date-2947317) made another appearance that was just as bizarre and confusing
as ever. It was a mixture of gameplay and cinematics, but still pretty damn
confusing.

There were a couple of smaller announcements thrown into the mix as well. Nioh
2 and Remedy’s Control was revealed, and we also saw a brand new PlayStation
VR announcement from FromSoftware, Dérasciné.

Oh, and there was yet another [Kingdom Hearts
3](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/kingdom-hearts-3-release-date-worlds-
news-trailers-and-rumours-2993095) trailer, because we haven’t seen enough of
that game already at E3 this year.

Overall, the conference didn’t have nearly the amount of punch as what
Microsoft had to offer. It’s not that anything we saw was bad, but the
conference was lacking in surprises, and it was a shame not to see any new
titles announced.

## EA at E3 2018

Personally, we hate going first, but EA seems to relish it, and scheduled its
own press conference for the Saturday before E3 2018 kicked off. During the
show, it attempted to focus equally on big-budget AAA titles as well as
smaller indie titles.

We saw small glimpses of [Battlefield
5](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/battlefield-5-release-date-3231890) and
[FIFA 19](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/fifa-19-release-date-3379113).
The former received an announcement that it would be getting its own Battle
Royale mode in an update after its release, and the latter will feature the
UEFA Champion’s League.

Indie titles like Sea of Solitude and Unravel 2 also got demonstrations, and
the latter even got a surprise announcement that it’s available right now.

Command and Conquer: Rivals, a new mobile strategy experience was also
announced with an on-stage presentation. NBA Live 19 and [Madden NFL
19](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/madden-19-release-date-3466838)
received new trailers alongside release details.

Saving the best until last,
[Anthem](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/anthem-release-date-gameplay-
release-date-preorder-news-2951518) received a huge amount of new information
through a cinematic trailer and developer insight into gameplay, story and how
monetization will work in the upcoming RPG (in short: there’ll be cosmetic
items to purchase but no loot boxes). Bioware also provided us with plenty of
new footage of Anthem in action. It looks fantastic, and could really be
something special. ****

Games**](https://www.trustedreviews.com/guide/upcoming-ps4-games)

## Bethesda at E3 2018

Bethesda’s conference this year was a slightly odd mix of games that we should
expect very shortly, and others that won’t be available for years to come.

Representing the latter were [The Elder Scrolls
6](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/elders-scrolls-6-release-date-2993132)
and [Starfield](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/starfield-release-
date-3484396), while in the former camp we got a November release date for
[Fallout 76](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/fallout-76-release-
date-3479330) and the announcement of an ambitious new cross-platform Elder
Scrolls experience called ‘Blades’ which will bring together platforms as
diverse as mobile phones and PC virtual reality.

[Rage 2](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/rage-2-release-date-3472822)
received a new gameplay trailer, and we can’t wait to try out the game for
ourselves.

Doom received a sequel with [Doom
Eternal](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/doom-eternal-release-
date-3483704), and [Wolfenstein
Youngblood](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/wolfenstein-youngblood-
release-date-3484374) will offer another opportunity to kill some alternative
history Nazis.

Check out our full coverage of the conference on our [Bethesda E3 2018
page](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-to-watch-bethesda-e3-press-
conference-3480032).

## Ubisoft at E3 2018

Ubisoft brought some serious fun at this year’s E3. Opening its conference
with a big marching band (a tie in to Just Dance 2019), the publisher then had
a developer drive a motorcycle into the auditorium to announce Trials Rising.

Elsewhere it was a more predictable conference. [Beyond Good and Evil
2](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/beyond-good-and-evil-2-release-
date-2993129) got a new trailer after its surprise announcement last year, and
[Assassin’s Creed Odyssey](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/assassins-
creed-odyssey-release-date-gameplay-3480002) was fully detailed featuring RPG
elements and a choice of assassins to play as.

[The Division 2](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/the-division-2-release-
date-3415602) received a host of new details, including the news that the game
will feature raids for the first time, and [Skull and
Bones](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/skull-and-bones-release-
date-2993779) got another pair of trailers.

Finally, Nintendo made a brief appearance to announce Starfox for Starlink:
Battle for Atlas, a new toys-to-life venture by Ubisoft.

## Square Enix at E3 2018

Square Enix haven’t done their own presentation at E3 for a number of years,
and its presentation this year was a good indication of why. The company just
didn’t have anything new to announce, so while we got extended looks at
[Kingdom Hearts 3](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/kingdom-
hearts-3-release-date-2993095), [Shadow of the Tomb
Raider](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/shadow-of-the-tomb-raider-release-
date-preview-2939265), and [Just Cause
4](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/just-cause-4-release-date-3478275), the
presentation was light on new details.

That being said, Platinum Games’ Babylon’s Fall looked incredibly cool, and
could be the cryptic action title the studio has been teasing in recent
months.

Check out our [full guide to Square Enix’s
presentation](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-to-watch-square-
enix-e3-2018-conference-3478151) for a complete overview of what was
announced.

## E3 2018 date – when is it?

E3 2018 takes place from **June 12 – 14**.

The big publishers such as Sony, Microsoft, Bethesda, EA, and Nintendo will be
holding press conferences and streams ahead of the event itself. You can find
out times and dates of all these conferences below.

## E3 2018 Tickets – How can I get them?

E3 will once again be open to the public in 2018 with tickets for the
convention now on sale. Tickets will soon be available on the [official
website](https://www.e3expo.com/). The ‘Gamer Pass’ for the first 1000
customers will cost $149. Following that, it will be increased to $249.

It’s also worth noting the general public will be allowed in three hours after
industry professionals, which accounts to 2pm on Tuesday, June 13 and 12pm on
Wednesday, June 14.

Press conferences from the likes of Nintendo, Sony, Microsoft and EA happen in

and dates thus far below:

  * **Ubisoft –** Monday June 11 at 1:00pm PT / 9PM GMT
